name: verbose_level
longdoc:
Verbosity level for information logging.
 - ``0``: Only errors
 - ``1``: Warning
 - ``2``: Process Information
 - ``3``: Object Information
 - ``4``: Debug

name: data_type
longdoc: Reconstruction floating number precision (``'single'`` or ``'double'``)

name: run
longdoc: Reconstruction run identifier. If ``None``, the run name will be constructed at run time from other information.

name: dry_run
longdoc:
Run everything skipping all memory and cpu-heavy steps (and file saving).
**NOT IMPLEMENTED**

name: paths
longdoc: The paths parameters can contain format strings with keywords from the runtime directory. The most likely are "run", "engine", "iterations".

name: home
longdoc: home is the root directory for all input/output operations. All other path parameters that are relative paths will be relative to this directory.

name: recons
longdoc: Reconstruction file name or format string (constructed against runtime dictionary)

name: autosave
longdoc: Auto-save file name or format string (constructed against runtime dictionary)

name: data
shortdoc: Processed data file name (or format string)

name: plots
shortdoc: Plot images file name (or format string)

name: active
longdoc: If ``True`` the current reconstruction will be saved at regular intervals. **unused**

name: interval
longdoc: If ``>0`` the current reconstruction will be saved at regular intervals according to the pattern in :py:data:`paths.autosave` . If ``<=0`` not automatic saving

name: interaction
longdoc: If ``None`` or ``False`` is passed here in script instead of a Param, it translates to  ``active=False`` i.e. no ZeroMQ interaction server.

name: active
longdoc: Set to ``False`` for no  ZeroMQ interaction server

name: primary_address
shortdoc: The address the server is listening to.
longdoc:
The address the server is listening to.
TODO: allow for automatic address definition when running on a cluster.

name: primary_port
shortdoc: The port the server is listening to.
longdoc: The port the server is listening to.

name: port_range
shortdoc: The port range opened to clients.
longdoc: The port range opened to clients.

name: autoplot
longdoc: In script you may set this parameter to ``None`` or ``False`` for no automatic plotting.

name: active
longdoc: If True, a plotting client will be spawned and connected at initialization. This option should be set to False when ptypy is run on a cluster.

name: interval
shortdoc: Number of iterations between plot updates
longdoc: Requests to the server will happen with this iteration intervals. Note that this will work only if interaction.polling_interval is smaller or equal to this number.

name: some_plotting_options
shortdoc: Options for default plotter (not implemented yet)
longdoc: Options for default plotter (not implemented yet)

name: dump
shortdoc: Switch to dump plots as image files

name: dump_interval
longdoc: If None, no image will be saved. If 0, only a final image will be saved.

name: make_movie
shortdoc: Produce reconstruction movie after the reconstruction.
longdoc: Switch to request the production of a movie from the dumped plots at the end of the reconstruction.

name: scan
longdoc: This categrogy specifies defaults for all scans. Scan-specific parameters are stored in scans.scan_%%

name: tags
shortdoc: Comma seperated string tags describing the data input
longdoc: [deprecated?]

name: if_conflict_use_meta
shortdoc: Give priority to metadata relative to input parameters
longdoc: [useful?]

name: source
shortdoc: Describes where to get the data from.
longdoc:
Accepted values are:
 - ``'file'``: data will be read from a .ptyd file.
 - any valid recipe name: data will be prepared using the recipe.
 - ``'sim'`` : data will be simulated according to parameters in simulation

name: dfile
longdoc: If source was ``None`` or ``'file'``, data will be loaded from this file and processing as well as saving is deactivated. If source is the name of an experiment recipe or path to a file, data will be saved to this file

name: label
longdoc: Unique string identifying the scan

name: shape
shortdoc: Shape of the region of interest cropped from the raw data.
longdoc:
Cropping dimension of the diffraction frame
Can be None, (dimx, dimy), or dim. In the latter case shape will be (dim, dim).

name: save
longdoc:
Mode to use to save data to file.
 - ``None``: No saving 
 - ``'merge'``: attemts to merge data in single chunk **[not implemented]**
 - ``'append'``: appends each chunk in master \*.ptyd file
 - ``'link'``: appends external links in master \*.ptyd file and stores chunks separately in the path given by the link. Links file paths are relative to master file.

name: center
shortdoc: Center (pixel) of the optical axes in raw data
longdoc: If ``None``, this parameter will be set by :py:data:`~.scan.data.auto_center` or elsewhere

name: psize
longdoc: Dimensions of the detector pixels (in meters)

name: distance
longdoc: In meters.

name: rebin
longdoc: Rebinning factor for the raw data frames. ``'None'`` or ``1`` both mean *no binning*

name: orientation
longdoc:
- ``None`` or ``0``: correct orientation
 - ``1``: invert columns (numpy.flip_lr)
 - ``2``: invert columns, invert rows
 - ``3``: invert rows  (numpy.flip_ud)
 - ``4``: transpose (numpy.transpose)
 - ``4+i``: tranpose + other operations from above

Alternatively, a 3-tuple of booleans may be provided ``(do_transpose, do_flipud, do_fliplr)``

name: energy
shortdoc: Photon energy of the incident radiation

name: min_frames
shortdoc: Minimum number of frames loaded by each node

name: num_frames
shortdoc: Maximum number of frames to be prepared
longdoc: If `positions_theory` are provided, num_frames will be ovverriden with the number of positions available

name: chunk_format
shortdoc: Appendix to saved files if save == 'link'

name: auto_center
shortdoc: Determine if center in data is calculated automatically
longdoc:
- ``False``, no automatic centering 
 - ``None``, only if :py:data:`center` is ``None`` 
 - ``True``, it will be enforced

name: load_parallel
shortdoc: Determines what will be loaded in parallel
longdoc: Choose from ``None``, ``'data'``, ``'common'``, ``'all'``

name: positions_theory
longdoc: If provided, experimental positions from :any:`PtyScan` subclass will be ignored. If data preparation is called from Ptycho instance, the calculated positions from the :py:func:`ptypy.core.xy.from_pars` dict will be inserted here

name: experimentID
longdoc: If None, a default value will be provided by the recipe.

name: simulation
longdoc: Similar to scan, simulation takes Parameters trees in the same form `illumination`, `sample` and `xy`. Any item in these trees will take precedence over scan specific parameters in the simulated scan.

name: detector
longdoc: Can also be ``None`` if no detector specific filter is wanted or a string that matches one of the templates in the detector module

name: psf
longdoc: Value passed here represents the FWHM of a Gaussian. ``None`` means no point spread.

name: object_share_with
shortdoc: Label or index of scan to share object with.
longdoc:
Possible values:
 - ``None``: Do not share
 - *(string)*: Label of the scan to share with
 - *(int)*: Index of scan to share with

name: probe_share_with
shortdoc: Label or index of scan to share probe with.
longdoc:
Possible values:
 - ``None``: Do not share
 - *(string)*: Label of the scan to share with
 - *(int)*: Index of scan to share with

name: geometry
longdoc: All distances are in meters. Other units are specified in the documentation strings.

name: energy
longdoc: If ``None``, uses `lam` instead.

name: lam
longdoc: Used only if `energy` is ``None``

name: resolution
longdoc: This parameter is used only for simulations

name: prop_type
longdoc: Either "farfield" or "nearfield"

name: xy
longdoc:
These parameters are useful in two cases:
 - When the experimental positions are not known (no encoders)
 - When using the package to simulate data.

In script an array of shape *(N,2)* may be passed here instead of a Param or dictionary as an **override**

name: model
longdoc:
The type must be one of the following:
 - ``None``: positions are read from data file.
 - ``'raster'``: raster grid pattern
 - ``'round'``: concentric circles pattern
 - ``'spiral'``: spiral pattern

In script an array of shape *(N,2)* may be passed here instead

name: spacing
longdoc: Spacing between scan positions. If the model supports asymmetric scans, a tuple passed here will be interpreted as *(dy,dx)* with *dx* as horizontal spacing and *dy* as vertical spacing. If ``None`` the value is calculated from `extent` and `steps`

name: steps
longdoc: Number of steps with length *spacing* in the grid. A tuple *(ny,nx)* provided here can be used for a different step in vertical ( *ny* ) and horizontal direction ( *nx* ). If ``None`` the, step count is calculated from `extent` and `spacing`

name: extent
longdoc: Defines the absolut maximum extent. If a tuple *(ly,lx)* is provided the extent may be rectangular rather than square. All positions outside of `extent` will be discarded. If ``None`` the extent will is `spacing` times `steps`

name: offset
shortdoc: Offset of scan pattern relative to origin
longdoc: If tuple, the offset may differ in *x* and *y*. Please not that the offset will be included when removing scan points outside of `extend`.

name: jitter
shortdoc: RMS of jitter on sample position
longdoc: **Only use in simulation**. Adds a random jitter to positions.

name: count
longdoc: Only return return positions up to number of `count`.

name: illumination
longdoc: In script, you may pass directly a three dimensional  numpy.ndarray here instead of a `Param`. This array will be copied to the storage instance with no checking whatsoever. Used in `~ptypy.core.illumination`

name: model
longdoc:
One of:
 - ``None`` : model initialitziation defaults to flat array filled with the specified number of photons
 - ``'recon'`` : load model from previous reconstruction, see `recon` Parameters
 - ``'stxm'`` : Estimate model from autocorrelation of mean diffraction data
 - *<resource>* : one of ptypys internal image resource strings
 - *<template>* : one of the templates inillumination module

In script, you may pass a numpy.ndarray here directly as the model. It is considered as incoming wavefront and will be propagated according to `propagation` with an optional `aperture` applied before

name: photons
shortdoc: Number of photons in the incident illumination
longdoc: A value specified here will take precedence over calculated statistics from the loaded data.

name: recon
shortdoc: Parameters to load from previous reconstruction

name: ID
shortdoc: ID (label) of storage data to load
longdoc: ``None`` means any ID

name: layer
shortdoc: Layer (mode) of storage data to load
longdoc: ``None`` means all layers, choose ``0`` for main mode

name: stxm
shortdoc: Parameters to initialize illumination from diffraction data

name: label
shortdoc: Scan label of diffraction that is to be used for probe estimate
longdoc: ``None``, own scan label is used

name: form
longdoc:
One of:
 - ``None`` : no aperture, this may be useful for nearfield
 - ``'rect'`` : rectangular aperture
 - ``'circ'`` : circular aperture

name: diffuser
shortdoc: Noise in the transparen part of the aperture
longdoc:
Can be either:
 - ``None`` : no noise
 - ``2-tuple`` : noise in phase (amplitude (rms), minimum feature size)
 - ``4-tuple`` : noise in phase & modulus (rms, mfs, rms_mod, mfs_mod)

name: size
longdoc: May also be a tuple *(vertical,horizontal)* in case of an asymmetric aperture

name: central_stop
shortdoc: size of central stop as a fraction of aperture.size
longdoc: If not None: places a central beam stop in aperture. The value given here is the fraction of the beam stop compared to `size`

name: offset
shortdoc: Offset between center of aperture and optical axes
longdoc: May also be a tuple (vertical,horizontal) for size in case of an asymmetric offset

name: propagation
shortdoc: Parameters for propagation after aperture plane
longdoc: Propagation to focus takes precedence to parallel propagation if `foccused` is not ``None``

name: parallel
longdoc: If ``None`` or ``0`` : No parallel propagation

name: focussed
shortdoc: Propagation distance from aperture to focus
longdoc: If ``None`` or ``0`` : No focus propagation

name: antialiasing
longdoc:
Antialiasing factor used when generating the probe. (numbers larger than 2 or 3 are memory hungry)
**[Untested]**

name: spot_size
longdoc: If not ``None``, this parameter is used to generate the appropriate aperture size instead of :py:data:`size`
validity: foccussed is not None and foccused!=0

name: diversity
longdoc: Can be ``None`` i.e. no diversity

name: noise
shortdoc: Noise in the generated modes of the illumination
longdoc:
Can be either:
 - ``None`` : no noise
 - ``2-tuple`` : noise in phase (amplitude (rms), minimum feature size)
 - ``4-tuple`` : noise in phase & modulus (rms, mfs, rms_mod, mfs_mod)

name: power
shortdoc: Power of modes relative to main mode (zero-layer)

name: shift
shortdoc: Lateral shift of modes relative to main mode
longdoc: **[not implemented]**

name: sample
longdoc: In script, you may pass a numpy.array here directly as the model. This array will be passed to the storage instance with no checking whatsoever. Used in `~ptypy.core.sample`

name: model
longdoc:
One of:
 - ``None`` : model initialitziation defaults to flat array filled `fill`
 - ``'recon'`` : load model from STXM analysis of diffraction data
 - ``'stxm'`` : Estimate model from autocorrelation of mean diffraction data
 - *<resource>* : one of ptypys internal model resource strings
 - *<template>* : one of the templates in sample module

In script, you may pass a numpy.array here directly as the model. This array will be processed according to `process` in order to *simulate* a sample from e.g. a thickness profile.

name: recon
shortdoc: Parameters to load from previous reconstruction

name: ID
shortdoc: ID (label) of storage data to load
longdoc: ``None`` is any ID

name: layer
shortdoc: Layer (mode) of storage data to load
longdoc: ``None`` is all layers, choose ``0`` for main mode

name: label
shortdoc: Scan label of diffraction that is to be used for probe estimate
longdoc: ``None``, own scan label is used

name: process
longdoc: Can be ``None``, i.e. no processing

name: offset
shortdoc: Offset between center of object array and scan pattern

name: zoom
longdoc: If ``None``, leave the array untouched. Otherwise the modeled or loaded image will be resized using :py:func:`zoom`.

name: formula
longdoc: A Formula compatible with a cxro database query,e.g. ``'Au'`` or ``'NaCl'`` or ``'H2O'``

name: density
longdoc: Only used if `formula` is not None

name: thickness
longdoc: If ``None``, the absolute values of loaded source array will be used

name: ref_index
longdoc: If ``None``, treat source array as projection of refractive index. If a refractive index is provided the array's absolute value will be used to scale the refractive index.

name: smoothing
longdoc: Smooth the projection with gaussian kernel of width given by `smoothing_mfs`

name: diversity
longdoc: Can be ``None`` i.e. no diversity

name: noise
shortdoc: Noise in the generated modes of the illumination
longdoc:
Can be either:
 - ``None`` : no noise
 - ``2-tuple`` : noise in phase (amplitude (rms), minimum feature size)
 - ``4-tuple`` : noise in phase & modulus (rms, mfs, rms_mod, mfs_mod)

name: power
shortdoc: Power of modes relative to main mode (zero-layer)

name: shift
shortdoc: Lateral shift of modes relative to main mode
longdoc: **[not implemented]**

name: spectrum
shortdoc: Amplitude of relative energy bins if the probe modes have a different energy

name: object_dispersion
shortdoc: Energy dispersive response of the object
longdoc:
One of:
 - ``None`` or ``'achromatic'``: no dispersion
 - ``'linear'``: linear response model
 - ``'irregular'``: no assumption

**[not implemented]**

name: probe_dispersion
shortdoc: Energy dispersive response of the probe
longdoc:
One of:
 - ``None`` or ``'achromatic'``: no dispersion
 - ``'linear'``: linear response model
 - ``'irregular'``: no assumption

**[not implemented]**

name: scans
shortdoc: Param container for instances of `scan` parameters

name: numiter_contiguous
longdoc: The engine will not return control to the caller until this number of iterations is completed (not processing server requests, I/O operations, ...)

name: probe_support
shortdoc: Fraction of valid probe area (circular) in probe frame

name: clip_object
shortdoc: Clip object amplitude into this intrervall

name: probe_update_start
shortdoc: Number of iterations before probe update starts

name: update_object_first
shortdoc: If False update object before probe

name: overlap_converge_factor
shortdoc: Threshold for interruption of the inner overlap loop
longdoc: The inner overlap loop refines the probe and the object simultaneously. This loop is escaped as soon as the overall change in probe, relative to the first iteration, is less than this value.

name: overlap_max_iterations
shortdoc: Maximum of iterations for the overlap constraint inner loop

name: probe_inertia
shortdoc: Weight of the current probe estimate in the update

name: object_inertia
shortdoc: Weight of the current object in the update

name: fourier_relax_factor
shortdoc: If rms error of model vs diffraction data is smaller than this fraction, Fourier constraint is met
longdoc: Set this value higher for noisy data

name: obj_smooth_std
shortdoc: Gaussian smoothing (pixel) of the current object prior to update
longdoc: If None, smoothing is deactivated. This smoothing can be used to reduce the amplitude of spurious pixels in the outer, least constrained areas of the object.

name: type
longdoc: [only 'gaussian' is implemented for now]

name: floating_intensities
shortdoc: If True, allow for adaptative rescaling of the diffraction pattern intensities (to correct for incident beam intensity fluctuations).

name: intensity_renormalization
shortdoc: A rescaling of the intensity so they can be interpreted as Poisson counts.

name: reg_del2
shortdoc: Whether to use a Gaussian prior (smoothing) regularizer.

name: reg_del2_amplitude
shortdoc: Amplitude of the Gaussian prior if used.

name: smooth_gradient
shortdoc: Smoothing preconditioner. If 0, not used, if > 0 gaussian filter if < 0 Hann window.

name: scale_precond
shortdoc: Whether to use the object/probe scaling preconditioner.
longdoc: This parameter can give faster convergence for weakly scattering samples.

name: scale_probe_object
shortdoc: Relative scale of probe to object.

name: probe_update_start
shortdoc: Number of iterations before probe update starts

name: engines
longdoc: All engines registered in this structure will be executed sequentially.
